meanings.definition: A person who dishonestly claims to have special knowledge and skill in some field, typically medicine.
meanings.sent1: The town was fooled by the quack who claimed he could cure any illness.
meanings.sent2: The villagers learned to avoid the quack who promised miracle cures.
meanings.sent3: The quack tried to sell magic beans as a cure for all ailments.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the quack who promises quick fixes but delivers nothing.
meanings.sent5: The quack's false claims were exposed when his potions did not work.

meanings.definition: The characteristic harsh sound made by a duck.
meanings.sent1: The quack of the duck echoed across the pond.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the duck's loud quack.
meanings.sent3: The quack of the duck startled the sleeping cat nearby.
meanings.sent4: The quack of the duck broke the peaceful silence of the morning.
meanings.sent5: The quack of the duck was a familiar sound in the park.

meanings.definition: To make the characteristic harsh sound of a duck.
meanings.sent1: The duck began to quack loudly as it waddled by.
meanings.sent2: The pond was filled with the sound of ducks quacking.
meanings.sent3: The children laughed as they tried to quack like ducks.
meanings.sent4: The ducks quacked in unison, creating a cacophony of noise.
meanings.sent5: The duck quacked happily after finding a tasty treat.
